alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, James Island, West Ashley, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, Boone Hall Plantation, Charleston Naval Complex, Sullivans Island, Fort Johnson, Don Holt Bridge, Cainhoy, Wando and Charles Towne Landing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
